title.narrative: Public Finance Management Technical Assistance Project

description.narrative: The objective of the Public Finance Management (PFM) Technical Assistance Project for Russian Federation is to improve transparency and results focus in public financial management and build institutional foundations for improved budget efficiency, effectiveness, and accountability. The project has five components. The first component is tax policy and administration. This component strengthens the revenue base of government by modernizing important aspects of tax policy and administration. The second component is improving efficiency of the system of inter-governmental fiscal relations and sub-national PFM. This component addresses the vertical efficiency of government financing to sub-national government and helps to strengthen PFM at sub-national level. The objective of this component is to increase efficiency and effectiveness of the system of federal or regional fiscal transfers to regional or municipal governments. The third component is support for the development of e-budget system. This component provides more efficient information flows through development of an integrated financial management system which are an essential part of better management and control. This project component is expected to support some of the activities identified in the Ministry of Finance (MOF's) broader e-budget action plan, to complement the MOF's ongoing efforts for developing and implementing the key modules of the system. The fourth component is enhancing budget efficiency. This component improves expenditure planning, control, and monitoring. This component will provide advice to the government on the design and implementation of key aspects of this program, based on international good practices. The fifth component is project management. This component will strengthen the borrower's capacity to ensure timely implementation of project activities, adherence to procedures and

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Agency Agreement | Description :The Borrower shall cause the PIU to perform its obligations under the AgencyAgreement signed between the Borrower and the PIU. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Operations Manual | Description :The Borrower shall cause the PIU to carry out the Project in accordancewith the provisions of the Project Operations Manual. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project implementation arrangements | Description :At all times during the implementation of the Project, theBorrower shall maintain the Working Group, the Sub-groups established bythe Working Group for each of the components, and theProject Implementation Unit. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

title.narrative: Federal standards for accounting and financial reporting in the public sector, based on IPSAS, are developed and implemented

baseline.value: 5 federal accounting standards drafted but not implemented. New law on accounting wil be effective from January 2013, requiring useof uniform federal accounting standards.

target.value: 28 federal standards approved by the MOF Order

actual.value: 5 federal standards approved by the MOF Order. 23 standards have been drafted, gone through public hearings and are expected to besubmitted to the Accounting Council before the end of December 2017. MoF expects the review and approval by the Accounting Councilearly in 2018, following which MoF will promptly issue its order to approve the standards.

title.narrative: Improved results focus in annual and 3 year budgets through transition to program budgeting

baseline.value: Budget allocations are not linked with strategic policy objectives and measurable results.

target.value: 3 year budget is approved on the basis of state programs95%of State programs are approved by the Government

actual.value: After temporary suspension of 3 year budgeting federal budget was developed for 2017-2019 based on more than 50% expenditurecoverage by programs linked to strategic policy objectives and measurable results. Actual coverage during 2017 was estimated atabout 56 percent of federal expenditures. 95% of government programs out of total number of government programs planned have beenapproved by the Government of the Russian Federation.

title.narrative: Reformed tax regime for oil and gas sector

baseline.value: Fiscal reforms set out in Instruction #700-p of May 3, 2012 and Instruction #433-p of April 12, 2012

target.value: Amendments to the relevant regulation on oil taxation are adopted. Administration of the new tax system, continued tax maneuver inthe oil sector.

actual.value: Tax "manouver" has been implemented. Relevant amendment to the Tax Code and Customs Code drafted, approved by the Government andsubmitted to the State Duma. The amendment is expected to be approved during spring session of the Parliament.

title.narrative: Internal audit is introduced at the federal level in Russia

baseline.value: Internal audit function is not implemented The new approaches to the internal budget control were reflected in the GovernmentDraft Law on Amendments to the Budget Code in the Area of State Financial Control

target.value: Internal audit standards are adopted. 70% of federal ministries and agencies submitted internal audit reports.

actual.value: Internal audit standards have been drafted and MoF expects the target for 2017 to be fully met by the end of March 2018. MoF stillneeds the revisions to the Budget Code and the Government Order #193 to be approved (expected in the first quarter 2018) in orderfor the standards to be implemented. To ensure that the work is being carried out even prior to the formal approval, MoF has issuedthe text of the standards as guidelines for the federal ministries and agencies.

title.narrative: Implementation of the Government budget reform Program till 2018

baseline.value: The Program is drafted, but not approved

target.value: The Program is approved by the Government and implemented

actual.value: The program was approved by the Government Decision on December 30, 2013 #2593-p. Year 4 milestones are expected to be achieved. Tobe confirmed in early 2018.

title.narrative: Coverage of the federal budget appropriations with performance indicators depicting goals and results of budget implementation
Maximum time spent on tax calculation and payment by SMEs (within Doing Business rating)
Number of regions with PFM quality satisfactory to MOF
Open budget index (calculated by International budget partnership)
Reduction of time for processing documents due to implementation of E-Budget system
Increase in the share of information published on the single budget system portal which is automatically generated based on E-Budget system data
Ratio of tax declarations sent electronically through the created IT infrastructure
Percentage of expenditures of consolidated budgets of RF subjects generated under the programs in the total amount of expenditures of RF subjects
Index of impact of results from implementation of E-Budget system on indicators that reflect quality of financial management of thechief administrators of budget funds

Number of RF subjects in which the share of subsidies from the federal budget during two of three latest reporting fiscal years exceeded 40 percent of own revenues of the consolidated budget of RF sub
